channel.title: The RS-Hacking case
channel.description:
As you all have noticed, I was forced to take down rs-hacking.com, which is very unfortunate, clearly... My host was sent this message:
To whom it may concern; I represent Jagex Limited, developer and publisher of massively multiplayer online games, including RuneScape. A website which is hosted using your services has recently come to our attention. We believe that this website breaches your acceptable use policy and in doing so negatively impacts our game: rs-hacking.com The site owner is responsible for the distribution of software programs (Bots) which enable RuneScape users to circumvent the game’s security measures and infringe Jagex’s intellectual property rights. The owner is promoting the use of Bots with the knowledge that they are encouraging and enabling users to breach their contracts with us. I would be very grateful if someone could look at this webpage with a view to having it removed. Thank you for your time, and I look forward to your response.
I am currently waiting to be put in touch with Jagex and I'm still weighing my options on the matter, however, it appears from this rather cowardly act, that they obviously have no other way to touch me... So basically, I'm doing nothing wrong. I do not intend to discontinue the community and I hope I can have it back up and running by the end of the month.

item.title: The RS-Hacking case
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:46, topic:329274”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=425663.msg3260003#msg3260003 date=1278428029]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=425663.msg3259881#msg3259881 date=1278412630]

Lol, they are suing ruler.

Jagex better be careful what they really want to do vs what could happen even if they do succeed in shutting him down. If his code does not use any of theirs, even if it hooks into theirs (which is legal to do btw), its HIS code, he can open source it and give it away = tons more botters I would think.

I only read part of it, but some parts are just way out there wacky. I doubt they win this unless they just run him out of money and he gives up the fight.

[/quote]PS it is not legal to do what he does.

What does he do that is illegal code-wise? I know his using of runescapes icons and such is illegal.
[/quote]Using reflection is very much illegal if it is used to access a product they do not have permission to[/quote]

Haha, no, it isn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: The RS-Hacking case
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:329274”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=425663.msg3126845#msg3126845 date=1266102111]

There is no reason for you to take anything down.

Unfortunately my hosting company says otherwise…
[/quote]

Your hosting company has nothing to do with it. Jagex sends them a notice, as long as they forward it to you, and you respond in the given amount of time, your host is free from all liability. If your host doesn’t know this, they are idiots and you need to get a new host ASAP.[/quote]Yeah, I forgot when the hosting company can refuse service for whatever reason…

Read full topic

item.title: The RS-Hacking case
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Actually it is between two companies, the papers specifically mention Impulse Software (et al)

Anyway, shit just takes a while. It doesn’t really matter how small the company is though does it, I can’t imagine the MMOGlider peeps were a massive setup, and they ended up losing … was it 6 million?

I don’t think Ruler has quite the income of those guys, but he’s clearly making some dough.

EDIT:

Btw to supplement what the bank said

6/21/2010 18 Assented to MOTION for Extension of Time to 6/30/2010 to File Response/Reply to Defendants' Motion to Dismiss by JAGEX LIMITED.(Bryan, Erin) (Entered: 06/21/2010) 6/21/2010 Magistrate Judge Robert B. Collings: ELECTRONIC ORDER entered granting 18 Motion for Extension of Time to File Response/Reply to 6/30/2010 to Defendants' Motion to Dismiss (Dolan, Kathleen) (Entered: 06/21/2010) 6/9/2010 17 MEMORANDUM in Support re 16 MOTION to Dismiss for Lack of Jurisdiction and Improper Venue filed by IMPULSE SOFTWARE, ERIC SNELLMAN, MARK SNELLMAN. (Attachments: # 1 Exhibit "A", # 2 Exhibit "B")(Sanks, Terry) (Entered: 06/09/2010) 6/9/2010 16 MOTION to Dismiss for Lack of Jurisdiction and Improper Venue by IMPULSE SOFTWARE, ERIC SNELLMAN, MARK SNELLMAN.(Sanks, Terry) (Entered: 06/09/2010)

Read full topic

item.title: The RS-Hacking case
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

(c) Information Residing on Systems or Networks At Direction of Users.— (1) In general.— A service provider shall not be liable for monetary relief, or, except as provided in subsection (j), for injunctive or other equitable relief, for infringement of copyright by reason of the storage at the direction of a user of material that resides on a system or network controlled or operated by or for the service provider, [b]if the service provider—[/b] (A) (i) does not have actual knowledge that the material or an activity using the material on the system or network is infringing; (ii) in the absence of such actual knowledge, is not aware of facts or circumstances from which infringing activity is apparent; or [b](iii) upon obtaining such knowledge or awareness, acts expeditiously to remove, or disable access to, the material;[/b]

Read full topic

item.title: The RS-Hacking case

brb off to email JaGeX’s host for DCMA violation

Read full topic

item.title: The RS-Hacking case
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:24, topic:329274”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=425663.msg3128139#msg3128139 date=1266197389]
They do not have to remove it, because they are not responsible for putting it there. If the complaining company actually proved it was infringing content they could take it down, but a simple email is not proof.
[/quote]

No, they don’t HAVE to remove it.

But by not doing so they waive their right to protection from liability that the DMCA provides. (If it actually is a valid request obivously)[/quote]

If that was the case, then you are saying the DMCA mandates that hosts make judgments as to whether the request is valid or not, and there is no way the DMCA requires hosts to make those judgments.

Freddy1990:

Well, my host won’t host the site anymore unless Jagex agrees on terms to let me resume it, lol, so I’m screwed there, but I’ll probably move the site to another host.

Get a new host.

Read full topic
